content.description: This route can either be done in one pitch with a 60m rope or it can be done in two pitches to reduce rope drag going over the apex. If you break it in two there is anchors set at the apex.
content.location: This is the left most climb. The begining is moderate up low angle slab that leads into the more vertical corner feature. Pull up this ad your on steeper slab with some fun bolts to clip

content.description:
Pitch 1: Climb to the anchors or the natural belay just as you would for lost stopper.

Pitch 2:  Climb through a steep section with a bolt that protects. Follow a Right facing dihedral to the top
content.location: pitc one is same as lost stopper, pitch two head right in te dihedral

content.description:
Pitch 1: Climb to anchors 60 ft up or get to the natural belay at a good ledge 80 ft up.

Pitch 2: Take the direct up not following the swoop to the right. Climb a steep section where a bolt protects, then follow the crack up that leads left.
content.protection: pro from .5" to 3" set of stoppers
content.location: Start on the Left of the BIG facing dihedral in the middle of the rock.

content.description: A mellow route with a thought-provoking crux about halfway up the first pitch.
content.protection: 10 bolts to first 2-bolt anchor; 4 bolts to the top anchor
content.location: On the right side of the north buttress

content.description: An easy low angle first pitch brings you to the money pitch, which combines an early overhang with some nice slab moves above it to the anchors.
content.protection: Bring 12 draws.  Two-bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Leftmost route on the North Buttress.

content.description: This route goes up to the roof and traverses under to the right for about 20 ft. Then pull the roof with safe protection and proceed on slabs to the top
